Portal 2 - The Final Hours is a digital book that takes you deep within the top-secret offices of Valve for an unvarnished look at the creative process behind Portal 2. Now with a free bonus chapter added!

Much like the first game, Portal 2 is very tightly paced, but I'd be lying if I said I thought as highly of the puzzles in this game as the first game. Don't get me wrong- they're still fun to solve, utilize physics properties creatively, have clever mechanics and get your brain thinking. But they're not quite as open-ended as the first game's. The puzzles in the first game could usually be solved in more than one way, but in 2 they feel much more restrictive. The puzzles are still fun to solve but it certainly hurts the story's replay value, especially since the puzzles don't quite reach the same level of challenge as the first game. Speaking of the story, it's executed a bit less than optimally as well in my opinion. Portal's story gave a nice contrast between comedic brashness and dark undertones but Portal 2's can't seem to stop reminding you how humorous the dialogue is at all times. It's well written dialogue for sure, but it's just not a very good continuation of Portal 1's atmosphere. It also tends to include some more heavy handed plot-twist moments that don't feel very in line with the spirit of Portal to me personally. Despite those issues the game is still very much fantastic. The dialogue is clever, the new puzzle mechanics are interesting, the progression is great, the variety is even better than the first game and the polish is immaculate. The soundtrack and sound effects are great additions that reflect the curious solitude of the test chambers adeptly. Overall it's a very good sequel despite some hurdles that kept it fro, becoming amazing. It feels like Valve leaned a bit harder into the Portal that the fanbase saw versus the Portal that they saw and created something based on that train of thought.
I haven't tried the multiplayer yet but I've heard great things about it so if you enjoy co-op games then it's probably worth picking this one up.
I'd recommend this game if:
- You like puzzlers
- You like funny dialogue
- You like co-op games
- You enjoyed the first portal and wanted to see if you'll like this one too
Despite the problems I have with it, Portal 2 is great and I'd suggest anyone try it out. It's just that those problems hold it back from being a true masterpiece in my eyes.
